text: Another alternative location for A Kitchen at Downtown East.. they have many varieties in the menu to choose from, serving portions are big. Generally the foods are tasty and nice.. as for pork trotter, it would be better for me if they are softer and easy to bite off. üòÜ Overall, I think it's more value for money than typical zichar.

During crowded times. super slowwwwwwwwwwwwwww service.n think Chef cooked.for the wrong table. Those who came after us n ordered the sam dish , got all their food served. We end up munching our plain noodles.n vege which I ordered later separately. Told 3 servers, they stared blankly n never follow up.  Food taste good (thr only saving grace). price above.norm. afterall a restaurant.  Need to improve their ORDERING SYSTEM TO GET THE SEQUNCE OF FOOD ORDER CORRECTLY. FIRST COME FIRST SERVE.

Doing a community service here. Come at your own risk.

Food was terrible and tasteless. Service was very slow, our orders came one at a time. When we ask the waiters where is our food, they just simply acknowledge and didn't give us an update. For the same price go to the one at pasir ris 8 xiang xiang hu nan is soooo much better. Disappointing.
